item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "We were young, and we had no need for prophecies. Just living was itself an act of prophecy." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "But even if we don't have the power to choose where we come from we can still choose where we go from there. We can still do things." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "It's fear that makes us lose our conscience. It's also what transforms us into cowards." -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description:
"Do you understand how amazing it is to hear that from an adult? Do you know how amazing it is to hear that from anybody? It's one of the simplest sentences in the world, just four words, but they're the four hugest words in the world when they're put together.
You can do it." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description: "In a way fighting was just like using magic. You said the words, and they altered the universe. By merely speaking you could create damage and pain, cause tears to fall, drive people away, make yourself feel better, make your life worse." -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You are going to live a good and long life filled with great and terrible moments that you cannot even imagine yet." -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "You have been told that, even like a chain, you are as weak as your weakest link. This is but half the truth. You are also as strong as your strongest link. To measure you by your smallest deed is to reckon the power of the ocean by the frailty of its foam. To judge you by your failures is to cast blame upon the seasons for their inconstancy." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Julie Klausner
item.description: "Jealousy always trumps schadenfreude! It’s a rule from the heartbreak version of ‘rock, paper, scissors." -- Julie Klausner

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "This may be the most important proposition revealed by history: 'At the time, no one knew what was coming." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Not everyone has a sob story, Charlie, and even if they do, it's no excuse." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I just think it's bad when a boy looks at a girl and thinks that the way he sees her is better than she actually is. And I think it's bad when the most honest way a boy can look at a girl is through a camera." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description: "The real problem with being around James was that he was always the hero. And what did that make you? Either the sidekick or the villain." -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Five minutes of a lifetime were truly spent, and we felt young in a good way." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description: "I got my heart's desire, he thought, and there my troubles began." -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Even if you managed to escape from one cage, weren't you just in another, larger one?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Things like this don't happen all that often in one lifetime. This is the magnificent world of a picaresque novel. Just brace yourself and enjoy the smell of evil. We're shooting the rapids. And when we go over the falls, let's do it together in grand style!" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "A person learns how to love himself through the simple acts of loving and being loved by someone else." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I can bear any pain as long as it has meaning." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Being alive, if you had to define it, meant emitting a variety of smells" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "In the name of God, they stole her time and her freedom, putting shackles on her heart. They preached about God's kindness, but preached twice as much about his wrath and intolerance." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book. And then there are books like An Imperial Affliction, which you can't tell people about, books so special and rare and yours that advertising your affection feels like betrayal" -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Is it still cool to go to the mall?' she asked. 'I take quite a lot of pride in not knowing what's cool,' I answered." -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I liked being a person. I wanted to keep at it." -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "There will come a time when all of us are dead. All of us. There will come a time when there are no human beings remaining to remember that anyone ever existed or that our species ever did anything. There will be no one left to remember Aristotle or Cleopatra, let alone you. Everything that we did and built and wrote and thought and discovered will be forgotten and all of this will have been for naught. Maybe that time is coming soon and maybe it is millions of years away, but even if we survive the collapse of our sun, we will not survive forever. There was time before organisms experienced consciousness, and there will be time after. And if the inevitability of human oblivion worries you, I encourage you to ignore it. God knows that’s what everyone else does." -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You're arguing that the fragile, rare thing is beautiful simply because it is fragile and rare. But that's a lie, and you know it." -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Some tourists think Amsterdam is a city of sin, but in truth it is a city of freedom. And in freedom, most people find sin." -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Oh, I wouldn't mind, Hazel Grace. It would be a privilege to have my heart broken by you." -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Some wars," he said dismissively. "What am I at war with? My cancer. And what is my cancer? My cancer is me. The tumors are made of me. They're made of me as surely as my brain and my heart is made of me. It is a civil war, Hazel Grace, with a predetermined winner." -- John Green

item.title: Mrs. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Because there is no glory in illness. There is no meaning to it. There is no honor in dying of." -- John Green
